question: I am 32 years old.  I had gestational diabetes and hypertension when i was pregnant with my fourth child who is now three.  In March 2011 I found out that I have diabetes type II as well as hypothyroidism.  In June I went back for normal blood work and was told that my calcium was high.  I don't know the number, but it was high enough that they admitted me in hospital for observation.  At this time they took me off of almost all my meds to see if that was why my calcium was high.  The meds were ruled out, so they did two chest x-rays and ruled out sarcoidosis.  They took a bunch more labs and apparently found that my ACE levels were high as well.  After checking my PTH 3 times finally ruled out a parathyroid problem.  I have been sent to a hypertension specialist for my BP and am now seeing an Endocrinologist and still have not found out what is wrong with me.  I experience constipation on a regular basis and have to take stool softeners to aid with this.  I am tired all of the time and sometimes have a hard time just getting off of the couch due to muscle weakness and pain.  I am not in extreme pain but feel sore on a constant basis as if I have been training for a marathon or something.  I have been experiencing headaches daily in all different parts of my head.  I get dizzy easily  and have to hold on to something for a moment to catch myself.  My feet are extremely painful to stand or walk on.  I know that I have to try to stay active and the best way for me to do that has been for me to park on the other side of campus so that I will have to walk to my class and back and to take the stairs instead of the elevator to the second floor.  Thankfully I attend a small college and don't have too terribly far to walk.  Grocery shopping is a chore and I have found myself sitting on the floor in the bread isle because I was so tired and hurting.  My doctors won't come out and tell me I have cancer I guess because they don't know for sure yet but I am going crazy waiting to find out what is wrong with me.  All of my research has pretty much pointed toward cancer so is it safe to say I have cancer?  That I am just waiting to find out which kind?  Why is it taking so long to find out what is wrong with me?  When will they start doing more than blood tests?  I have been having blood test regularly since June.  Isn't it time to look deeper?  I am so stressed out.  I am tired of crying and worrying.  I have 4 children to take care of, I  don't have time to be sick.  Please, can someone give me some kind of advice, etc.Thanks
title: Hypercalcemia, low PTH, high ACE
